intro: Strophis, commonly known as the genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae, comprises several species native to tropical and subtropical regions. These plants are characterized by their showy, often colorful flowers and are typically shrubs or herbs. Many Strophis species have lance-shaped leaves and produce clusters of small, tubular flowers. They are often found in moist, shaded environments and are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal. Some species are used in traditional medicine for their potential therapeutic properties.
